title: Urban Design Forum releases new policy platform aimed at guiding NYC's next Mayor
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: Candidates for the upcoming New York City Mayoral election have been invited to participate in a newly launched Vision for a Better City advocacy platform by the Urban Design Forum. The effort unites electoral politics with the Forum’s mission to reconnect urban design with city...
text: anchor Photo: Andreas Komodromos/Flickr (CC BY-NC 2.0) Candidates for the upcoming New York City Mayoral election have been invited to participate in a newly launched Vision for a Better City advocacy platform by the Urban Design Forum.  The effort unites electoral politics with the Forum’s mission to reconnect urban design with city life. It comes as New Yorkers face an unprecedented affordability and housing crisis, among other social issues, despite steady increases in quality of life, low crime, and near-record-high employment rates. "The next mayor has the power to transform daily life for every New Yorker — but only with bold, visionary moves," Guillermo Gómez, the Forum’s director of programs, tells Archinect: "Vision for a Better City brings together the deep expertise of thoughtful and talented leaders from our network across all five boroughs and lays out the big ideas our city needs. The path to a better New York is clear. Now we need leadership that’s ready to make it happen." Related on Archinect: Unpacking the factors behind New York City's complex housing crisisThe new project is built around six core "pillars" of Public Health, Mobility, Public Space, Housing, Climate Action, and Economic Development. Candidates for Mayor will respond to 25 ideas within them. The ideas have been consolidated over the winter as part of the Urban Design Forum Fellows program.  Finally, the Forum notes: "Thoughtful design is key to building a city we’re proud to call home. It can tackle multiple challenges at once, from bringing neighbors together to addressing climate change. This document lays out a vision to make that happen." The election takes place on November 4th, 2025.

    Candidates for the upcoming New York City Mayoral election have been invited to participate in a newly launched Vision for a Better City advocacy platform by the Urban Design Forum. 

    The effort unites electoral politics with the Forum’s mission to reconnect urban design with city life. It comes as New Yorkers face an unprecedented affordability and housing crisis, among other social issues, despite steady increases in quality of life, low crime, and near-record-high employment rates.

    "The next mayor has the power to transform daily life for every New Yorker — but only with bold, visionary moves," Guillermo Gómez, the Forum’s director of programs, tells Archinect: "Vision for a Better City brings together the deep expertise of thoughtful and talented leaders from our network across all five boroughs and lays out the big ideas our city needs. The path to a better New York is clear. Now we need leadership that’s ready to make it happen."

    The new project is built around six core "pillars" of Public Health, Mobility, Public Space, Housing, Climate Action, and Economic Development. Candidates for Mayor will respond to 25 ideas within them. The ideas have been consolidated over the winter as part of the Urban Design Forum Fellows program. 

    Finally, the Forum notes: "Thoughtful design is key to building a city we’re proud to call home. It can tackle multiple challenges at once, from bringing neighbors together to addressing climate change. This document lays out a vision to make that happen."

    The election takes place on November 4th, 2025.
